greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of simple graphs on n unlabeled nodes having chromatic number k, 1 <= k <= n.
comment: T(n,1) = T(n,n) = 1 (here we count the empty graph and the complete graph).  T(n,n-1) = n-1 (here we count the graphs with clique number equal to n-1). - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Oct 12 2016
Row sums give A000088. - _Joerg Arndt_, Oct 13 2016
link: Keith Briggs, combinatorial graph theory, see entry "number of graphs on n nodes with clique number k".
FindStat - Combinatorial Statistic Finder, The chromatic number of a graph.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Chromatic Number
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, n-Chromatic Graph
program: (Sage) # prints triangle with a leading zero in each row
